cluster_node

The class has all the methods to create and visualize a cluster

{% raw %}

class cluster_node[source]

cluster_node(name, density=None, parent=None, children=None) :: cluster

A Basic class of a cluster

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Methods (cluster_node)

In the following section the mos important methos of the cluster_node class are review

create polygon

Create a random polygon of the cluster node

{% raw %}

cluster_node.create_polygon[source]

cluster_node.create_polygon(from_points_num=20)

Generate a random polygon for the cluster

:param from_points_num: The number of points to generate the cluster from

{% endraw %}

Random points

Generate random points inside cluster

{% raw %}

cluster_node.create_random_points[source]

cluster_node.create_random_points(npoints_polygon=1000, random_state=120)

Create random points

:param npoints_polygon Number of point to get

:random_state Random state integer to ste random

:returns: A shapely multyPoint clas witn npoints_polygon points

{% endraw %}

scale

Scale the points inside the cluster

{% raw %}

cluster_node.scale[source]

cluster_node.scale(x_scale, y_scale, center_scale='center')

Scale the points in the cluster

:param x_scale Scale factor to scale in x axis

:param y_scale Scale factor to scale in y axis

:param center_scale Scale center point (Default = 'center')

:returns: No returns

{% endraw %}

Get density

Number of point in the cluster/Area of the polygon cluster

{% raw %}

cluster_node.get_density[source]

cluster_node.get_density()

Get the density of the cluster

:returns double: The density of the node

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

cluster_node.tag_low_level_noise_signal[source]

cluster_node.tag_low_level_noise_signal(point_check=None)

The tag the element of the node using the labels noise or signal as a tag, if a set of point is pass (point_check != None) the elements are treated as part of the cluster and label it accordingly.

:params list point_check: A list of shapely Points to tag (if None tags the points inside the cluster)

:returns: A list of tuples (points , tag)

{% endraw %}

Helper functions

Functions to help build the nodes

inside_polygon

Check if a min percentage of point are inside a polygon

{% raw %}

inside_polygon[source]

inside_polygon(list_points, poligon_check, min_percent)

Help function to validate the number of points that are inside the polygon

:param list list_points: List of points to concider

:param shapely.geometry.Polygon poligon_check:

:param min_percent: Minimun percent of point to be consider inside

:returns bool: True If the amount of points are inside.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

poligon_non_convex_from_Points

Function create a polygon from a list of points

{% raw %}

poligon_non_convex_from_Points[source]

poligon_non_convex_from_Points(points_li)

Create a random (no convex) poligon from the points The algorithm returns a polygon creatated from the points, the non convex part it is not always guaranteed.

:param list points_li: list of shapely.geometry.Point

:returns shapely.grometry.Polygon: The polygon created

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

poligon_non_convex_random_gen

Creates a poligon from a random number of points

{% raw %}

poligon_non_convex_random_gen[source]

poligon_non_convex_random_gen(npoints)

Create a random (no convex) poligon from n points The algorithm returns a polygon creatated from n random 2d points the non convex part it is not always guaranteed.

:param int npoints: Number of point to generate the polygon

:returns shapely.grometry.Polygon: The poligon created

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
